properties.areaDesc: Lake Superior from Saxon Harbor WI to Upper Entrance to Portage Canal MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian border including Isle Royal National Park; Ontonagon to Upper Entrance of Portage Canal MI; Munising to Grand Marais MI; Lake Superior west of a line from Saxon Harbor WI to Grand Portage MN beyond 5NM; Black River To Ontonagon MI; Lake Superior from Upper Entrance to Portage Canal to Manitou Island MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian Border; Saxon Harbor WI to Black River MI; Lake Superior East of a line from Manitou Island to Marquette MI and West of a line from Grand Marais MI to the US/Canadian Border Beyond 5NM from shore; Upper Entrance of Portage Canal to Eagle River MI; Eagle River to Manitou Island MI; Marquette to Munising MI
properties.headline: Gale Warning issued February 19 at 3:52AM EST until February 21 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy freezing spray at a rate of 2 cm per hour or
greater occurring, and may rapidly accumulate on vessels. West
winds 20 to 30 kt with gusts up to 40 kt and waves 7 to 10
feet expected.

* WHERE...Portions of Eastern and Western Lake Superior.

* WHEN...For the Heavy Freezing Spray Warning, until 7 AM EST /6
AM CST/ Thursday. For the Gale Warning, from 1 PM EST /noon
CST/ Thursday to 4 AM EST /3 AM CST/ Friday.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in heavy freezing spray is
hazardous. Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic
components inoperative. Rapid ice accretion on decks and
superstructures may result in a catastrophic loss of
stability. Strong winds will cause hazardous waves which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should prepare for dangerous accumulation of ice on
their vessel. If possible, remain in port, avoid the warning area
or conduct mitigation.

Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ THURSDAY... ...GALE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM EST /NOON CST/ THURSDAY TO 4 AM EST /3 AM CST/ FRIDAY
